    • Method Detail

      • average

        public static double[] average(Collection<double[]> vectors)
        Compute the index-wise average of all the given vectors. All vectors need not be the same length. If a value contains Double.NaN it is not included in the average.
        Parameters:
        vectors - list of double arrays to be averaged. They need not be the same length.
        Returns:
        never null. If no valid values were seen for a given index across all vectors, then NaN is placed into the output at the corresponding index. The returned array is of length equal to maximum length of the input vectors.

      • normalizeStandardDeviation

        public static double[] normalizeStandardDeviation(double[] v,
                                                  boolean zeroMean,
                                                  boolean inPlace)
        Normalize the standard deviation of the vector and optionally set the mean to 0.
        Parameters:
        v - data to base return values on
        zeroMean - if true, then also remove the mean from the input vector.
        inPlace - if true, then modify the input vector, otherwise create a new array.
        Returns:
        a vector of the same length as the input and allocated accordign to inPlace.

      • normalize

        public static double[] normalize(double[] v,
                                 boolean normalizeStddev,
                                 boolean zeroMean,
                                 boolean inPlace)
        Parameters:
        v -
        v - data to base return values on
        normalizeStddev - if true, then normalize the inputs relative to the standard deviation. If false, then normalize to the range of values.
        zeroMean - if true, then also remove the mean from the input vector.
        inPlace - if true, then modify the input vector, otherwise create a new array.
        Returns:
        a vector of the same length as the input and allocated accordign to inPlace.

      • autoCorrelate

        public static double[] autoCorrelate(double[] vector)
        Calculate the auto-correlation vector for the given data. Index of returned array is the amount of shift of one vector relative to the other. So index 0 is the unshifted correlation. The correlation for correlation index CI s defined as 1/N * (Sum over i of v[i] * v[i+CI]) where i+CI is a valid index and N is the number of valid indices for a given CI. No checks are made for validity (i.e. not NaN or Infinity) of the data provided.
        Parameters:
        vector -
        Returns:
        an array of the same size as the input.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if vector is null or zero length.

      • correlationVector

        public static double[] correlationVector(double[] vector1,
                                         double[] vector2)
        Compute the vector of correlations between the two vectors. The correlation value at index i represents the correlation between the two vectors using a shift of i indices in which the shorter vector is shifted to index i in the longer vector.
        Parameters:
        vector1 -
        vector2 -
        Returns:
        an array of length equal to the length of the longest vector provided.

      • getInterleavedData

        public static double[] getInterleavedData(double[] interleavedData,
                                          int nDimensions,
                                          int index)
        Get the ith dimension from a vector of data that is formatted with N-dimensional interleaved data.
        Parameters:
        interleavedData - data the has N dimensions of data interleaved/multiplexed. For example, 3-D spatial data would be contained in the vector as (x0,y0,z0,x1,y1,z2,...xN,yN,zN). The length of the input must be an integer times the number of dimensions (so that each dimension has the same length).
        nDimensions - Number of dimensions of data.
        index - 0-based index of the dimension to extract. 0 would be x0..xN in the 3-D spatial example.
        Returns:
        an array of lenght interleavedData.length/nDimensions.

      • zeroPad

        public static double[] zeroPad(double[] data,
                               int newSamples)
        Create a new array of the requested length, filled with data from the given array. If there is not enough source data, then pad/fill the output with 0s.
        Parameters:
        data -
        newSamples - size of output array. May be less then the given data array length.
        Returns:
        never null.

      • duplicatePad

        public static double[] duplicatePad(double[] data,
                                    int newSamples)
        Create a new array that is of the given size with data copied over 1 or more times to fill out the given size.
        Parameters:
        data - the source data to copy from
        newSamples - the size of the output array. May be less than the given data array.
        Returns:
        never null. An array of length newSamples with data array copied into it as many times as needed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • linearTransform

        public static double[] linearTransform(double[] data,
                                       double m,
                                       double b,
                                       boolean inPlace)
        Apply the linear transform y = mx + b to the values in the given vector.
        Parameters:
        data - values to be transformed.
        m - the slope
        b - the offset
        inPlace - if true, then the input array is modified in place, otherwise a new array is created to contain the transformed values.
        Returns:
        an array of the same length as the input.
